description: From Latin calyx, from Ancient Greek κάλυξ (kálux, “case of a bud, husk”). Doublet of chalice and kelch.

entries.meaning: (botany) The outermost whorl of flower parts, comprising the sepals, which covers and protects the petals as they develop.

definitionGroups.group: (zoology, anatomy) Any of various cup-like structures.

entries.meaning: A chamber in the mammalian kidney through which urine passes.
The crown containing the viscera of crinoids and similar echinoderms, entoprocts, and the polyps of some cnidarians.
A funnel-shaped expansion of the vas deferens or oviduct of insects.
A flattened cap of neuropil in the brain of insects.
